messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Update the phone number of the last person I sent a message to to +10293847563
I’m not sure who the “last person you sent a message to” is. Could you tell me this person’s name, phone number, or any other identifying detail so I can locate the correct contact and update it?
I don't have any more information about that person.

I’m sorry, but without at least one piece of identifying information—such as the person’s name, current phone number, relationship, or their entry’s ID—I have no way to locate the correct contact to update. If you can provide any of those details, even approximately, I can search for the contact and make the change.
Can you try to figure it out yourself? I don't have any more details.

I’m sorry, but I truly have no way to determine who the “last person you sent a message to” is. I don’t have access to your messaging history, and our contacts database can only be searched when you provide at least one identifying detail—like a name, an existing phone number, a relationship label, or an entry ID. Without any of that, I have no way to locate (and therefore update) the correct contact.

If you can supply even a small clue—part of a name, the old number (or part of it), how you know them, anything—I can search and make the update.
